subject.name: Help
subject.description:
help for OGen

> BerliOS project page

subject.name: what is OGen?
subject.description: OGen is a code generator. It generates code both on text files and database functions (PostgreSQL and SQL Server are currently supported) based on xml metadatas and aspx/xslt templates provided by users.

document.name: license
document.document: OGen is distributed under the GNU General Public License ("GNU GPL")

subject.name: introduction
subject.description: a more proper introduction to OGen

document.name: dependencies and pre-requisites
document.document:
If you don't plan to build from source or contribute to OGen you'll only need:
  • Npgsql
  • MySQL Connector/Net (support is on the way)

If you're building from source, or plan to contribute you'll also need:
  • build source files using SharpDevelop or Visual C# 2005 Express Edition (NAnt and MonoDevelop not supported yet)
  • a subversion client like TortoiseSVN (for windows) or Subversion (multi-platform)
  • NUnit
  • NDoc

document.name: installing OGen
document.document:
OGen at BerliOS: http://developer.berlios.de/projects/ogen /
  1. Building from Source:

    1. Anonymous Subversion Access via SVN: svn://svn.berlios.de/ogen/trunk
      or HTTP: http://svn.berlios.de/svnroot/repos/ogen/

    2. Once you have the sources, check the '_admin' directory for solution and scripts files.

      1. generate keys, needed to build solution:
        win-10-GAC-sn.bat

      2. if you're using visual studio, you'll need to define where to find dependant asseblies (even if they're in the GAC):
        win-20-GAC-registry.reg

      3. build the solution using any of the provided solutions:
        OGen-buildAssembies.cmbx (SharpDevelop)
        OGen-buildAssembies-7.1.sln (Visual Studio 2003)
        OGen-buildAssembies-8.sln (Visual C# 2005 Express Edition or Visual Studio 2005)
        OGen-buildAssembies.build (NAnt, not supported yet)

      4. makes copies of release assemblies into a common directory and installs them in the GAC:
        win-40-GAC-install.bat

  2. Getting Binaries:

    1. Not available yet.
